result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W Hadley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: RCJ for contempt for failure to pay by due date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 14CF83

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: 14CF1493

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.  If disabled, defendant must provide proof of disability to agent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant is not to enter into or loiter near taverns, bars or liquor stores.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victims, R.C., or J.W., (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with victim stores, Odd Fellows and WalMart, except for restitution purposes.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including cognitive intervention, psychological evaluation and anger management. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Jeffrey W Hadley in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. Parties stipulate to 7 yrs WPS total; bifurcated as 2 yrs WPS and 5 yrs ES. Deft has CFTS for the initial confinement time. Defense indicates they were not aware that the defendant would have to be taken into custody, go to Dodge and be released from there.

BTC: 13CF1503, Ct 1- Total sentence is 3 1/2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 2 yrs ES/CFTS - STAYED. 4 yrs prob
                            Ct 3- Total sentence is 3 1/2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 2 yrs ES, conc with Ct 1 - STAYED. 4 yrs prob
         14CF83, Ct 1- Total sentence is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, consec to 13CF1503 - STAYED. 5 yrs prob conc with 13CF1503
         14CF1493, Ct 1- Total sentence is 9 mos RCJ/CFTS, costs, DNA costs
                             Ct 2- Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, consec to 14CF83 - STAYED. 5 yrs prob conc with 14CF83
         15CF1426, Ct 1- Total sentence is 12 mos RCJ/CFTS, costs DNA costs

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
restitution - $384.67 to WalMart
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA'S
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically cognitive intervention, psych eval and FT, anger management, AODA assessment & FT
no contact with Odd Fellows or RC
no contact with Wal Mart
no contact with JW
not to enter into or loiter near taverns, bars or liquor stores
may go to restaurants that serve alcohol but may not drink alcohol
FT emp. If disabled, deft must provide proof of disability to agent

FAW/vote

NOT eligible for CIP or SAP
Racine County Alternatives Program

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey W Hadley in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State indicates that she had an extensive meeting regarding the plea and the State understood that the deft was agreeable and would change his plea today. Defense indicates that is not the case.
The State recites the agreement as she understood it. Defense recites the agreement as he understood it.

BTC: If there is no agreement by the next court date, the CM is going back to Misd court, the cases that were in Br 8 will go back and Br 4 cases will be set for trial  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Ct 1: 943.50(1m)(d)-RT/Intentionally Conceal; Cts 2 & 3: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ; Cts 4 & 5: 946.49(1)(a)-Misd. BJ. No contact with victim store ODD FELLOWS except for restitution purposes.  Defendant is to enroll in and participate in an active alcohol and drug program and an AODA assessment if not already done. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jeffrey W Hadley in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jeffrey W Hadley in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Judge Flancher has consolidated all files to Br 4. Defense indicates there is a global resolution. Defense also asks the Court to address bond. Defense asks that deft be granted signature bonds in all cases as the recommendation of the State does not contemplate additional jail time. The State agrees to signature bond as long as the deft gets into an AODA program that HE has to pay for and complete. The State asks that the Court continue conditions that were previously ordered including no controlled substances/monitoring and no contact with victims.

BTC: As to each case, bonds may be modified to $5000.00 signature bond. Conditions previously imposed in each case will remain. In all cases, deft, while out shall forthwith enroll in and participate in an active alcohol and drug program, AODA assessment if not already done. Upon release or as soon as possible, deft is to register with Racine Alternatives Program.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Review hearing on September 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
